intro: Haplopappus salicinus, commonly known as the slender pappus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert or arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant is well adapted to harsh conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
